1.ins_en: Add a weight to the left side of the balance scale
1.explain_en: The left side becomes two weights, and the balance scale tilts to the left

2.ins_en: Place a small iron block with consistent weight on each spring.
2.explain_en: The compression of the spring increases progressively from left to right.

3.ins_en: Place a helium-filled balloon in the room
3.explain_en: The balloon should float in the air

4.ins_en: Place a balloon filled with regular air in the room.
4.explain_en: The balloon should be lying on the floor.

5.ins_en: Place this person's right hand on a static electricity ball
5.explain_en: This person's hair should stand up

6.ins_en: Place a small wooden block in the water tank
6.explain_en: The small wooden block floats on the water surface

7.ins_en: Place a small iron block in the water tank
7.explain_en: The small iron block sinks to the bottom of the water tank

8.ins_en: Pour a little water onto this pile of dry ice
8.explain_en: A large amount of white fog will appear

9.ins_en: Pour some yellow oil into a measuring cup filled with water.
9.explain_en: The oil should float on top of the water.

10.ins_en: Pour some alcohol into the water cup.
10.explain_en: The water level rises, but the color does not change.

11.ins_en: Insert a pencil into a glass of water
11.explain_en: The pencil should appear 'broken' due to different refractive indices

12.ins_en: Place this glass of water in the cold storage overnight.

13.ins_en: Increase the air pressure to two standard atmospheres
13.explain_en: The water will no longer boil

14.ins_en: Pour some water into a glass filled with oil
14.explain_en: The water should settle at the bottom

15.ins_en: Describe the changes in the glasses when the warm indoor temperature suddenly drops

16.ins_en: Change the south direction in the image to the right side
16.explain_en: The compass arrow should point to the right

17.ins_en: Sprinkle iron filings on the surface to observe the magnetic field distribution.
17.explain_en: Iron filing distribution of a U-shaped magnet.

18.ins_en: Sprinkle iron filings on the desktop to observe the distribution of the magnetic field
18.explain_en: Iron filings distribution of a bar magnet

19.ins_en: Place a cup of water on the table in the image.
19.explain_en: The cup should also have a symmetrical reflection in the mirror.

20.ins_en: Change the water to high-concentration saltwater

21.ins_en: Remove the kitten from the screen
21.explain_en: The kitten in the mirror should also be removed accordingly

22.ins_en: Demonstrate the thermal effect of electric current
22.explain_en: The copper wire heats up due to the current

23.ins_en: Place a pickup truck to the right of the house
23.explain_en: There should be a reflection of the pickup truck on the surface of the lake

24.ins_en: Bathroom mirror after a hot shower

25.ins_en: Bathroom mirror after a cold shower

26.ins_en: Increase the pressure in this room by 20 atmospheres.
26.explain_en: No change to the water bottle.

27.ins_en: Increase the pressure in this room by 20 atmospheres.
27.explain_en: The water bottle gets crushed due to the impact of the atmospheric pressure.

29.ins_en: A beam of light enters from the left side of the glass prism

30.ins_en: Draw the state of the pendulum at the highest point on the left side
30.explain_en: The ball symmetrically appears at the position on the left side

31.ins_en: For a voltmeter connected to piezoelectric materials, demonstrate the voltage change after applying pressure.

32.ins_en: Draw the pattern of double-slit interference on the whiteboard on the right.
32.explain_en: A pattern of alternating bright and dark fringes as displayed on the detection screen is formed.

33.ins_en: Change to the experimental setup and pattern for red light single-slit diffraction
33.explain_en: The board transforms into a single slit, and the image displays a broad center with narrow sides

34.ins_en: Change in resistance after lowering the temperature to the critical temperature of the measured material

35.ins_en: Changes in resistance after increasing the temperature of the measured material

36.ins_en: Change the small ball hanging on the right in the image to a state of being negatively charged.
36.explain_en: The ball becomes tilted towards the far left.

37.ins_en: Place a paperclip in a cup of water to demonstrate the effect of surface tension.
37.explain_en: The paperclip floats on the water surface.

38.ins_en: Changes that occur after heating the liquid in this water bottle
38.explain_en: The red liquid level in the pipe rises

39.ins_en: Place a silk-rubbed glass rod near small bits of paper on the table.
39.explain_en: Some of the small bits of paper get attracted to the glass rod.

40.ins_en: Changes in the pendant after sudden braking of a moving car
40.explain_en: The pendant tilts towards the left front.

41.ins_en: Changes in the pendant when a stationary car suddenly accelerates
41.explain_en: The pendant tilts towards the rear-right direction

42.ins_en: Draw the light reflected by the upper mirror.
42.explain_en: The light is emitted towards the lower left.

43.ins_en: Press the switch in the picture
43.explain_en: Two small light bulbs light up

44.explain_en: The small light bulb at the bottom right lights up.

45.ins_en: Modify the scene to a warm and humid indoor glass window during winter

46.ins_en: Correct the indicated height of the erroneous thermometer in the image.
46.explain_en: The red liquid in the thermometer on the far left is at the highest level.

47.ins_en: Increase the atmospheric pressure outside the balloon.

48.ins_en: Changes in the balloon after the external atmospheric pressure is reduced.

49.ins_en: Change to measure the temperature of the ice-water mixture
49.explain_en: Adjust the temperature to 0 degrees Celsius

50.ins_en: Change in liquid level height after temperature decrease

51.ins_en: Remove the weights from the pan balance
51.explain_en: The white plastic object on top is removed, and the display shows zero

52.ins_en: A drop of water falls on the lake surface
52.explain_en: Concentric ripples spread outward on the water surface

53.ins_en: Release the hand pressing on the ball
53.explain_en: The spring elongates, and the ball rises

54.ins_en: Use a magnifying glass at noon to focus sunlight on a match for some time

55.ins_en: Remove the small iron rod in the picture
55.explain_en: The water stream returns to normal vertical downward flow

56.ins_en: Place toy cars at the same height on a smooth incline and a rough incline, and observe when the car on the smooth incline reaches the bottom
56.explain_en: The car on the rough incline is still on the slope

57.ins_en: Observe the change in hydrometer after pouring higher density salt water into the test tube
57.explain_en: The hydrometer floats higher, showing a higher reading on the scale

58.ins_en: Change to use a movable pulley to pull the bucket
58.explain_en: The pulley becomes a movable pulley, and the direction of the pull is upward

59.ins_en: Change the value to the result of reversing the diode direction

60.ins_en: Change to cover the lens with a blue filter and photograph the flower
60.explain_en: The red flower appears very dark or almost black through the blue filter

61.ins_en: Continuously heat a sealed gas tank, and show the change in pressure gauge

62.ins_en: Only keep the ray at the critical angle
62.explain_en: Only the red beam is retained, and the black beam is removed

63.ins_en: Pump the bicycle tire to a higher pressure
63.explain_en: The tire becomes more inflated, and the contact patch with the ground becomes smaller

64.explain_en: The cube on metal shows noticeably more melting

65.ins_en: Change to cover the lens with a red filter and photograph the green leaf
65.explain_en: The leaf appears very dark or almost black through the red filter

66.ins_en: Add equal drops of blue ink to two cups of water
66.explain_en: The ink disperses much faster in the hot water, forming a lighter cloud

67.ins_en: Rotate the polarizing filter 90Â° before the LCD screen
67.explain_en: The display becomes black due to crossed polarization

68.ins_en: Continue to pour some liquid into the left glass tube of the connected vessels
68.explain_en: The liquid levels in both glass tubes should always remain at the same height

69.ins_en: Direct a blower straight upward and place a small ball in the airstream
69.explain_en: The ball hovers stably in the vertical airflow due to the Bernoulli effect

70.ins_en: Show the level after the ice melts
70.explain_en: The water level remains the same after complete melting

71.ins_en: Change the environment of the chamber to a vacuum
71.explain_en: The water boils at room temperature under reduced pressure

72.ins_en: Pour oil with a refractive index similar to that of the glass rod into the cup
72.explain_en: The rod becomes nearly invisible due to minimal refraction

73.ins_en: Draw the highest point the ball can reach on the right
73.explain_en: The ball rises to the same height on the right, showing energy conservation

74.ins_en: Show the change after the rightmost ball of the Newton's cradle falls
74.explain_en: The leftmost ball is launched, and the other balls remain stationary

75.ins_en: Pull the A4 paper sharply and observe the cup
75.explain_en: The cup remains upright due to inertia
